Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionAECOM is seeking Project Site Engineer for Infrastructure works experience to be based on site in Bahrain. The successful candidate is responsible for works under the technical direction of the Resident Engineer and review & approval of all submittals as well as the technical supervision of senior/other inspectors  Job Duties  + Assisting the Resident Engineer in the management and administration of various construction contract packages.  + Reviewing the contractor's progress at all times.  + Monitoring the work performed, the material incorporated in the work, the materials stored at the site and the contractor's manpower, equipment and report.  + Coordinating the efforts of separate contractors and liaise with local authorities.  + Observing the safety procedures followed by the contractor.  + Issuing instructions as necessary to correct safety violations.  + Attending weekly, monthly and other progress meetings held at the site as required. Review the contractor's progress.  + Identifying constraints and recommend corrective measures.  + Remaining vigilant regarding all aspects of the construction activities and monitor the supervision consultant staff performance & their compliance with agreement terms.  + Assisting with preparation and transmittal of site directions and instructions.  + Coordinating with the team on site to ensure that contractual obligations are met. Carry out other tasks as may be assigned to you with your expertise from time to time.  + Undertaking overview supervision duties on site to ensure general compliance of the works with specification and contract requirements and when necessary cause to address deficiencies associated with the same.  + Coordinating all aspects of submittals, review and approvals against contract requirements and when applicable report and advice on deviations from the same.  + Coordinating as may be required with client on all specialist participation related to the final acceptance of the works.  + Assisting client in all aspects of the final acceptance of the work and close-out of all applicable contracts related to the same.  + Performs specific and limited portions of a broader assignment of an experienced engineer.  + Gathers and correlates basic engineering data using established and well-defined procedures.  + Works on detailed or routine engineering assignments involving calculations and relatively simple tests.  + Proposes approach to solve new problems encountered.  + Identifies discrepancies in results.  + Provides guidance to entry level engineers.  + Performs work in accordance with agreed upon budget and schedule with moderate supervision.  Minimum Requirements Person Specification: + Organized  + Proactive  + Ability to take ownership of tasks involved  + Very good communication and interpersonal skills  Experience  + Strong Construction supervision experience.  + Well experienced in the construction of Landscape and Civil/ Infrastructure Works.  + High level of critical thinking skills.  + High level of numerical skills.  + Strong English communication skills.  + Must have ability to utilize computer technology to access data, maintain records, generate reports etc  + Bahraini Nationals preferred  + Familiar with Bahrain Standards and specifications for execution of works  + MS Project and Prima Vera Experience will be added advantage  Preferred Qualifications  + A Bachelor’s Degree in Civil or equivalent with Minimum 5 years strong experience in the field  What We Offer  We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.  You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.  We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.  We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.  When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.  As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 3 days ago

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionDescription Job Description: Leidos Security & Detection Systems is a leading global provider of high value complex automation and control solutions to airports and to the wider aviation sector. Our success is built on our highly valued people who are passionate about customer satisfaction, who foster a winning ‘can do – get it done’ culture and who support our core values of Integrity, Excellence, Accountability and Respect. We focus on continuous improvement and excellent execution in everything we do with innovative leadership embracing the highest level of ethics and integrity. We would love to hear from talented candidates, who are passionate about working for a dynamic international business, share our passion, and value our culture. What you will be doing We are looking for a Qualified Field Technician to join our team at our highly successful Bahrain operations. Reporting to the Regional Service Supervisor with primary roles in troubleshooting and ongoing maintenance of airport security systems at our highly valued client’s site. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Under limited supervision and usually acting independently, performs a wide variety of technical support activities by installing, troubleshooting, maintaining and servicing x-ray and CT based security systems at customer sites. Typically handles complex products and/or problems and may provide technical guidance to lower level technicians. Helps develop and maintain relationships and favorable contacts with current and potential clients within MEAI region, etc. Helps ensure unparalleled client satisfaction through the delivery and maintenance of best-in-class security and detection products and related professional services. The duties and responsibilities may change from time to time without notice and include but are not limited to the duties described below. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Coordinates the planning and delivery of preventative maintenance (PM) services on various types of security search equipment to regional customers. Coordinates and provides support to regional customers by installing, calibrating, maintaining, testing, troubleshooting and repairing of x-ray and CT based security systems of a highly complex nature. Prepares and conducts formal and informal training courses for customer personnel in the operation and maintenance of systems and equipment. Provides on-site technical and operator training. Works with customer via phone or person to identify operations/technical problems. Responds to customer complaints and questions until resolved. Troubleshoots and diagnoses system/equipment interface problems during installations Acquaints customer personnel with the full capabilities of the equipment and/or systems for the immediate operational requirements. Advises customer of all equipment changes and authorized modifications. Conducts local visits to customer sites (airports) to help determine requirements, needs, and perceptions. Education and/or Experience: Graduate of technical school / or military training in electronics engineering technology/ or Bachler degree in electronic / electrical engineering or equivalent. Typically possesses more than five (5) years’ experience in field service environment with at least two (2) of which have been with a directly applicable industry and specific highly skilled knowledge of x-ray, CT technologies, and company’s products and equipment. Other Skills and Abilities: Excellent customer interface, presentation and communication skills, both verbal and written are required. Knowledge of complex digital and analog circuitry is required, Linux a plus. Knowledge of complex mechanical systems, familiarity with test equipment (DVM and oscilloscope) and experience with High Voltage and X-ray producing equipment preferred. Team player with ability to prioritize and work under pressure in a fast-paced environment with minimal oversight. Ability to perform multiple activities simultaneously and independently. Must be available to travel throughout Ireland on short notice, work non-standard hours, travel on weekends, and assist other field sites as required. May be required from time to time to lift heavy weights. Previous experience in all or some of the following areas: Security and Detection Systems Aviation Operating in a global environment The successful candidate will demonstrate a desire to produce a high standard of work at all times and become a member of a small but successful team. Based in the Kingdom of Bahrain Please note: To be considered for this role, you must be eligible to live and work in the Kingdom of Bahrain under Bahrain work visa . Relocation is not available for this role if visa not issued. Leidos Security & Detections Systems is committed to Equal Opportunity and Diversity Pay Range: The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 11 days ago

POSITION PROFILE The primary role of the MAC Construction Supervisor is to support and guide the MAC contractor personnel & relevant project team within the relevant discipline in achieving efficient development and safe, on-time, on budget, project completion. The position is accountable for the safety, quality, and timeliness of the contractor’s works within the appointed area/scope. This includes HSE implementation, contractor adherence to the latest drawings, and quality control by the maintenance of QC check sheets in accordance with the quality plan. RESPONSIBILITIES & ACCOUNTABILITY Ensure that contractors comply with all aspects of the Worksite HSE Plan and policy; site regulations, permit to work, Worley and Customer requirements. Perform MAC construction activities as per drawings, specifications and project documents in accordance with the project field procedures and site instructions. Ensure by leadership and guidance that MAC contracted works meet all practical, commercial, requirements of productivity, quality and contract target completions. Routinely study, check and review all contractor scope as detailed in drawings, specifications and instructions, ensuring contractors proper interpretation and compliance Ensure contractors' dimensional control methods for checking that the works are properly set out and supervise specialist surveying contractors where necessary. Ensure Quality inspectors and contractor supervisors carry out the witness, inspection and surveillance checks in accordance with the Worley Quality Plan and the requirements of the Quality Control Manager. Ensure that contractors are working in the required work areas, locations and elevations and that work sequence and interfaces with other contactors are both coordinated and planned to provide continuously working to meet contract schedules. Ensure that all quality control checks and tests are instigated, with records maintained and available. Ensure practical security and protection of the works and that all contractors’ provisions for the temporary plant are fit for purpose. Ensure that all construction materials, embedded items, special fixtures are approved for use and that they are stored, protected and available to workforce locations as required. Promote and maintain Worley, Customer and contractor best practice working relationships KEY SELECTION CRITERIA Communicating effectively in a range of environments and with Worley team members and Contractors Demonstrating excellent negotiation and problem-solving skills Well-developed technical and practical skills and able to consistently deliver quality, accurate and timely work to Worley and its customers. Solid technical and practical experience in the relevant discipline, including the ability to work to tight deadlines and prioritization of work to achieve them. A thorough understanding of industrial construction environment and proven supervisory experience in multi-disciplinary teams. With more than 1000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 6000 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.   At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:   Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!   Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!   Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.   As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.  We look forward to meeting you!!Your RoleTo accompany our partners/clients on complex and ambitious technological issue, we are looking for a Data Engineer (M/F), at our office in Brussels. As part of our team, you will be involved in the entire project lifecycle, from the upstream phases of consultant/design to the implementation of solutions.  Your main missions:You will work on the deployment of several use cases.Conduct tasks such as quality gating, integrating the projects into our logging infrastructure, guiding the original authors of the projects so that their code meets the quality criterias needed to go to production.Conda/pip package managementCode review/ quality gatekeepingIntegrate logging library into models for performance and usage monitoring (as well as dashboard creation)Your profile:You hold at least a Master's (Bac+5) degree in Software engineering, Information systems or a relevant fieldYou hold at least 2 years' experience in a relevant fieldYou have a strong experience in PythonYou have experience with http rest APIsYou have experience with Git (version control system).You have a good level of French and English (written, oral and comprehension). Dutch is a plus. Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability or other characteristics.Why us?Be part of an international, multicultural environment of 7,750 talented people over 60 countries and 5 continents Join a fast-growing global group with a turnover of €565M and over 1,000 clients across the worldExplore opportunities to grow quickly with a tailor-made career path: 70% of our key senior talent joined the company at entry levelTake advantage of over 500 training courses in our ACADEMY catalogue, which includes programs in interpersonal communication, team management, project management, etc.Get the opportunity to support nonprofit organizations thanks to our Foundation initiatives and volunteering platform OneSmallStepDepending on your performance and eligibility criteria, you can benefit from international mobility opportunities and progress your career worldwide, and/or experience other departments and sectorsUnlock your full potential, both professionally and personally.Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 30+ days ago

job_description: Data is one of Solita’s four areas of expertise. We have more than 200 data specialists, and our knowledge portfolio contains a variety of data-related specialisations involving data solutions in almost all technologies, both in the cloud and otherwise. In Solita, you will be part of a team that is courageous and passionate, but at the same time easy-going. As a Data Engineer you will:build technical solutions that consist of data models, data integration, storage and cloud based data pipelineswork 90-95% hands-on with configuration, integration, installation, scripting and 5-10% with designing architectures and explaining the solution to customers and team memberssit at the same table with the top leadership of our customers, IT and business decision-makers and data expertsuse your skills and vision to support the development of our customers’ businessWhat do we wish for you to have?Have experience in one or more of the following: data modelling, data warehousing, databases (SQL/NoSQL) and ETL/ELT. Experience in data warehouse automation in considered as a plusCan build data pipelines in one of the following programming languages: Python, R or JavaWe value interest and experience in cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)You are familiar with the software development practices such as version control and CI/CDCan implement data solutions for data experts and for business decision-makersHave an ability and motivation to learn quickly new technologies and methodologiesYou are fluent in English, and Dutch or FrenchSolita is a Nordic consulting firm specialized in helping companies and organizations in their digital transformation. We have implemented hundreds of data-driven solutions for large-scale companies and organizations and both automatized processes with the help of AI and Machine Learning and helped companies to create new data-based services. We have 1000 consultants in Sweden, Germany, Belgium, Finland and Estonia and now looking for a Data Engineers to our growing team in Leuven. Want to know even more? discover why Solita is a good place to work for our Belgian consultants. We foster a culture of experimentation and autonomy. We strive to provide added value to our customers through our own innovative software product development, which is changing working methods in the industry. The typical length of a project varies from one month to a few years, and the situation can be altered according to your wishes. We believe in autonomous way of working; you have the freedom to choose what you do and the responsibility to get it done. We use modern agile methodologies and modern technologies in our projects. You will have an influence on how Solita develops as a company. Let’s discuss & get to know each other! We value your skills, but we are also interested in you as a person. Send us your CV and informal application, and tell us what you are good at and what is your motivation for applying for this position.Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 30+ days ago

Job detailsJob TypePermanent contractFull Job DescriptionNous recherchons aujourd’hui, un(e) Chef de projet informatique - Systèmes applicatifs critiques pour conduire le projet de TMA des tunnels Cofiroute. Les domaines d’application dans lesquels nous œuvrons chez Actemium Paris Transport : infogérance de systèmes d’informations, automatismes industriels pour les nouvelles infrastructures de transport,... Nous avons par exemple réalisé : o Le système de sécurité incendie du RER E (EOLE SSI) ; o Le système de traction de la ligne 15 Sud (système SIL 2) pour la Société du Grand Paris ; o L’instrumentation d’ouvrages annexes et de sites de maintenance et remisage des lignes du Grand Paris ; o La GTC des gares de péages de Cofiroute ; o Le tunnel de Boissy-Saint-Léger pour la DiRIF ; o Des expérimentations de solutions dédiées aux véhicules autonomes sur le réseau de Cofiroute. Le projet : En tant que Chef de projet Système Applicatifs critiques, vous assurerez les missions suivantes : o Participation à la définition du besoin métier avec le client o Production des devis en support du Responsable d’affaires (analyses techniques, échanges avec le client, évaluation de la charge, planification) o Maitrise de l’architecture système des tunnels : connaissance technique et fonctionnelle des interfacesConnaissances réseauProtocoles (MODBUS, OPC-DA, …) o Suivi, pilotage et participation à la réalisation des développements (affectation des tâches, revues de codes / fonctionnelles, suivi avancement, alertes sur le respect des délais et du périmètre initial)Mise à jour socle documentaireOrganisation des recettes internes et des recettes client avec participation à des tests terrains si nécessaireInterface avec client pour organisation des mises en Pré-production et mises en production o Suivi de l’utilisation des environnements chez ACTEMIUMCoordonner leur utilisation suivant les versions en cours de réalisation/maintenanceCoordonner leurs mises à jourGestion de la salle serveur o Maintenance analyses d’incidents1er niveau d’analyse (reproduction du problème, identification de fonctionnement normal, bug)Affectation à un développeur si besoin d’analyse détailléeInterface avec le client (Explications, demandes d’informations complémentaires : logs, cahier de marche, horaires…)Participation à des tests terrains si nécessaire o Réunions techniques avec le client Issu(e) d'un cursus niveau BAC+5 (Ecole d’ingénieur, Master spécialisé), vous disposez d'une expérience de 5 ans dans un poste similaire. Idéalement, vous maitrisez des logiciels tels que Windev ou SQL Server. Vous pouvez aussi être amené à travailler sur des automates GE et de la supervision Cimplicity. Vous êtes rigoureux(se) et autonome et souhaitez rejoindre une équipe jeune et dynamique tout en relevant de nouveaux challenges ! Vous ne cochez pas toutes les cases mais vous avez lu toute notre offre ! Nous serons ravis d’en discuter avec vous. Nota Bene : Plusieurs études montrent que les femmes postulent moins fréquemment à une offre d’emploi car elles attendent d’avoir 80% des compétences demandées. Si vous êtes une femme et que cette offre vous intéresse, n’hésitez pas à postuler car nous saurons vous accompagner. Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?  A chaque instant de votre vie, vous bénéficiez des réalisations menées par VINCI Energies. o Vous êtes formés en qualité et sécurité chaque année durant notre Safety Week. o Vous bénéficiez de la force du groupe et de la mobilité pour développer vos compétences et évoluer dans votre carrière. o Nous contribuons au monde qui change en connectant les infrastructures, les bâtiments et les sites industriels aux flux d’informations et d’énergies pour améliorer votre quotidien. o Plus sûrs, plus propres ou plus innovants, les moyens de transport de demain se développent déjà aujourd’hui. Du tramway à la voiture électrique ou à la sécurisation et l’optimisation des infrastructures routières, VINCI Energies intervient au service de votre mobilité au quotidien.EntitéConnexion, performance, efficience énergétique, datas : dans un monde en évolution permanente, VINCI Energies accélère le déploiement des nouvelles technologies pour concrétiser deux mutations majeures : la transformation digitale et la transition énergétique. Ancrées dans les territoires et organisées en mode agile, les entreprises de VINCI Energies rendent les infrastructures d'énergie, de transport et de communication, les usines ainsi que les bâtiments chaque jour plus fiables, plus sûrs, plus efficients. 2021 : 15,1 milliards d'euros (chiffre d'affaires) // 85 700 collaborateurs // 1800 entreprises // 55 pays www.vinci-energies.comHiring InsightsJob activityPosted 30+ days ago

Solvay is a science company whose technologies bring benefits to many aspects of daily life. Our purpose—we bond people, ideas and elements to reinvent progress—is a call to go beyond, to reinvent future forms of progress and create sustainable shared value for all through the power of science. In a world facing an ever-growing population and quest for resources, we aim to be the driving force triggering the next breakthroughs to enable humanity to advance while protecting the planet we all share. We bond with customers and partners to address today and tomorrow’s megatrends. As a global leader in Materials, Chemicals and Solutions, Solvay brings advancements in planes, cars, batteries, smart and medical devices, water and air treatment, to solve critical industrial, social and environmental challenges. You can count on our innovative solutions to contribute to safer, cleaner and more sustainable future.   Role Overview  Job overview: Solvay initiated a profound transformation earlier this year and this transformation positioned digital technologies as key drivers to make it happen. It requires us to change the way we operate, to maximize value across the organization, and adapt to a faster pace of change while ensuring business continuity. We are now building our new Digital-Technology organisation, developing our skills and competencies to reinvent progress and to create together sustainable shared value for all. Be part of our transformation and drive the change as a member of our future team. We are ONE team that holds accountability as a key standard in our relentless pursuit to deliver value for our customers and stakeholders. In our agile and collaborative work environment we have fun to continue living our motto: reinvent progress.Within our Data, Analytics & AI Platform we are setting up hubs of expertise centers across our locations to be able to deliver cutting-edge data & analytics applications in support of our digital strategy and its products to transform Solvay. As a data engineer you will be part of a multi-disciplinary team along with Scrum Masters, Data Analysts, Data Scientists and Data Stewards to deliver data & analytics applications for our digital products. You will play a key role within the Platform by designing and building cutting edge data pipelines which can collect, process, transform and curate large amounts of data volumes in velocity and variety, while also integrating the needed data quality controls, metadata and monitoring mechanisms for a E2E data supply chain. His/her key responsibilities will be: Participate in sprint planning to estimate development effort Implements data pipelines for ingestion, creation, and transformation of sources and data models (batch or streaming) Develop and execute jobs to import data periodically Delivers data sourcing approach and datasets for analysis, with activities including data staging, ELT, data quality, archiving and retention Profile data and validate whether fit for purpose Executes system unitary, integration & performance testsEducation and experience: Master’s degree in a relevant course of studiesSkills: Hard Skills: Experience with Agile methodologies and DevOps/DataOps Experience in Requirements Engineering, Solution Architecture, Design, Development and Deployment Experience in integrating data into analytical platforms Experience with ingestion technologies (SAP InfoSteward, SAP BW, Spark, Kafka, Talend, Google Big Query) and storage (HDFS, HBase, Hive, Relational, etc.) Experience in data profiling, source-target mappings, ELT development, SQL optimization, testing and implementation Experience in SQL & other data manipulation languages essential (Pig, Python, Java) Experience with structured/unstructured data Track record of implementing databases and data access middleware and high volume processing involving large data stores Behavioral skills: Customer focused Excellent oral and written communication skills Able to work independently, creatively and collaboratively as part of a team Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Curiosity and appetite for Data and IT DomainsHiring InsightsJob activityPosted 2 days ago

"Data is the new oil" is a claim that is often made, pointing to the strategic importance data can have in enabling business success. However, the comparison is also true in another aspect: raw data, like raw oil, is quite useless. Just like raw oil, it needs to be refined, processed and distributed in a way that it supports important use cases before it can actually be of value. Designing, implementing and improving such pipelines, is what data engineering is all about.Responsibilities:In close collaboration with our clients, architects and product managers, It is your task to translate the client's business requirements into a data architecture.You're able to understand the business context of our clients and suggest approaches to improve their data strategy.As part of a multidisciplinary team, you design, implement and deploy data pipelines and data warehouses, closely collaborating with our architects, engineers, product managers, AI engineers and QA engineers.You'll support our AI engineers in deploying their models in production.You actively participate in knowledge sharing both towards peers (lessons learned, new advances, process improvements,..) as well as other people in our organisation (e.g. sales, marketing, product, strategy...). And it doesn't have to stop there: we happily support any initiatives to share our findings with the world, through blogs, talks, podcasts or guest lectures.You clearly communicate and set expectations. What realistic results can be expected? What are the greatest risks/unknowns? Always be open and honest, and don't be afraid to ask for help.Qualifications:You hold a bachelor/master degree in Computer Science (or related), or have prior experience in a similar roleYou have an excellent knowledge of Python, experience with other programming languages is a plus.You have experience with multiple database, data warehousing, data pipeline and event processing technologies, and you keep up with the state-of-the-artYou highly value solid engineering principles such as clean code, rapid prototyping, continuous improvement and continuous delivery.You at least have a high-level understanding of data science, allowing you to closely collaborate with our AI engineersYou have an affinity with product design and engineering top-notch digital products.Experience with the Google Cloud Platform, AWS or Azure is required.Additional information: In The Pocket is organised in autonomous teams consisting of developers, designers and product managers. By being part of one and the same team, they can develop a product from start to finish. Because every team carries responsibility, working at In The Pocket means accepting a high level of autonomy. We rely on trust and openness, and sharing our learning curve. At In The Pocket there’s time to experiment and budget to develop yourself. On a personal level we are looking for a colleague who shares our values.Ownership: Working at In The Pocket means accepting a high level of autonomy. You take ownership and show the ability to decide and act for the good of the company.Integrity: Stick to your values, even when it doesn’t pay off in the short term. In The Pocket relies on trust and openness, which in turn relies on your integrity.Lead & Educate: Digital technologies are changing the world. We go all in, head-first. We take the lead in designing and building with emerging technologies. Weshare our passion and knowledge with as many people as possible.Agility: In The Pocket is permanently under construction. We never settle,it’s never done. Observing, adapting and improving is in our nature. That resonates with the people who work here. We are always looking for a better solution, always ready for the next step, pragmatic and committed to move forward.Team: As individuals we are bright and talented, as a team we’re unbeatable. We are open and positive, constructive and honest. We help and inspire our colleagues to do their best work.Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 30+ days ago

You will enable our businesses to gain insight in their data so they can support their decisions with facts. You will be working with various kinds of data on multiple projects. You have experience with UML modelling and ER modelling      You are familiar with the concept of data pipelines and have some development experience on them. BenefitsPulled from the full job descriptionWork from homeWERKEN BIJ SIBELGA, DAT BOOST MIJN ENERGIE! Elke dag zetten onze 1 000 medewerkers zich in om 500 000 Brusselse gezinnen en ondernemingen van energie te voorzien. Op de werven of vanuit onze hoofdzetel in het hart van de hoofdstad, zetten onze teams zich in om de levenskwaliteit van de Brusselaars te verbeteren. Zij zijn de drijvende kracht van de energietransitie. BIJ WELKE DIENST KOM JE TERECHT? De dienst NRClick staat sinds 2010 ter beschikking van de Brusselse gemeentes en bepaalde paracommunale autoriteiten zoals OCMW's, politiezones, vzw's, alsook van verschillende gewestelijke instanties (DBDMH, Net Brussel, Brussels Parlement ...) enz.  De doelstellingen van deze dienst zijn:De unieke partner van de gemeentelijke en gewestelijke openbare besturen worden/blijven op het vlak van energie – aankoop, productie, distributie, gebruik, monitoring – en hen helpen om hun, al dan niet bindende, doelstellingen waar te maken op het vlak van energie-efficiëntie en het beheer ervan.Zich profileren als neutrale en onafhankelijke energiefacilitator met als doel een uniek aanspreekpunt te vormen voor de overheidsinstanties.De rol opnemen van neutraal integrator, facilitator, adviseur enz. maar ook van speler op het terrein. De dienst NRClick adviseert en begeleidt zijn klanten op het gebied van energiebeheer in verschillende domeinen.  Deze dienst is gebaseerd op een applicatie, NRClick Scan genaamd, waarvan de gegevens afkomstig zijn uit verschillende bronnen: gebruikers, Sibelga (SAP/andere), op het terrein verzamelde meetgegevens, commercieel energieleveranciers, externe gegevens (weer, reguleringssystemen van verwarmingsinstallaties …) …   De medewerkers van de dienst NRClick – monitoring - moeten niet alleen veelzijdig zijn om hun taken te kunnen uitvoeren, maar ook om het werk van afwezige collega's te kunnen overnemen.  De dienst NRClick werkt ook nauw samen met alle Customer Account & Energy Transition Solutions-diensten, het laboratorium en andere technische of administratieve diensten van Sibelga. JOUW JOB De belangrijkste taken van de "Data exploitation Field Engineer" zijn het mogelijk maken van de installatie en de exploitatie van de verbruiksgegevens van de door de NRClick-dienst geïnstalleerde of gekoppelde acquisitiesystemen van vanop afstand opgenomen data. Meer specifiek neemt hij/zij de volgende taken op zich:Hij/zij definieert, coördineert en neemt geheel of gedeeltelijk deel aan de installatie en inbedrijfstelling van acquisitiesystemen van vanop afstand opgenomen data:o bepaling, met de klant, van de contouren van het project voor de monitoring van de site, o opstelling van het "SiSu" (Site Survey), het bezoekrapport; o aanvragen van offertes voor aanpassingen aan de meet-, acquisitie- en bedradingssystemen, o administratieve follow-up van de dossiers (planning, bestellingen, opleveringen ...), o uitvoering, in voorkomend geval, van de bekabeling, de installatie van acquisitiesystemen en de verbinding van impulsen, o parametrisering, configuratie en montage van apparatuur vóór installatie, o eventuele programmering en configuratie van meters en van de gehele acquisitieketen in de NRClick Scan-applicatie, o follow-up van de werken, de voorlopige en definitieve oplevering, o strikte toepassing van de veiligheidsmaatregelen om de veiligheid en het welzijn van de werknemers, de aannemers en de klanten te waarborgen, o controle van de coherentie tussen meting en weergave, o validering van de verzamelde gegevens na inbedrijfstelling of aanpassing van de data-acquisitiesystemen, o validering van het as built-dossier en van externe prestaties, indien van toepassing.Naargelang de behoefte, voert hij/zij enkel het programmeer- en configuratiegedeelte van de acquisitieketen in de applicatie NRClick Scan uit wanneer de selectie en installatie van de systemen door collega's is gepland.Hij/zij is de referent en de steun in gegevensverwerving voor alle diensten ‘Energy Transition Solutions’.o Ondersteuning van collega's die belast zijn met de installatie van de data-acquisitiesystemen eigen aan hun systemen, in geval van problemen, o Configureert systematisch de volledige data-acquisitieketen in de NRClick Scan-applicatie voor de verschillende 'Energy Transition Solutions'-diensten, o Controleert de conversieparameters in de NRClick Scan-applicatie: impulsgewichten, TI/TP-verhoudingen, verliesberekeningen, enz., o Bij problemen die collega's ondervinden in verband met configuratie of apparatuur op het terrein, zorgt voor het opsporen en oplossen ervan, o Gebruikt analyse- en kwaliteitscontroletools voor gegevensverwerving.Hij/zij parametriseert de ‘bron’-applicaties en NRClick Scan om interfacing tussen applicaties mogelijk te maken en de stroom van meetgegevens van gegevenssystemen van Sibelga of derden (tq verwarmingsregulering, GTC enz.) en NRClick Scan te garanderen.Hij/zij werkt op verzoek van collega’s mee aan de inbedrijfstelling van de reguleringssystemen (gedeeltes communicatie, sturing, regulering van de parameters ...) die in het kader van diversificatiewerken gerenoveerd werden; volgt eveneens de goede werking van die installaties op door de nodige alarmen in te stellen. Hijzij adviseert de klant over alarmdrempels.Hij/zij onderhoudt de door de dienst geïnstalleerde of gekoppelde acquisitiesystemen.o Zorgt voor de dagelijkse opvolging van de goede werking van de acquisitiesystemen, o Detecteert de bron van eventuele storingen, o Biedt corrigerende of preventieve oplossingen, en zorgt voor de correctie van gegevens die aanwezig zijn of ontbreken in de NRClick Scan-applicatie, o Coördineert, indien nodig, de tussenkomsten van onderaannemers.Hij/zij verbetert bestaande tools of ontwikkelt nieuwe IT-tools om de configuratie, validatie en opvolging van de verschillende geïnstalleerde acquisitiesystemen te vergemakkelijken en te optimaliseren.Hij/zij neemt deel aan het onderzoek, het testen, de validatie en de implementatie van nieuwe methoden voor gegevensverwerving in overleg met collega's. Hij/zij zorgt eveneens voor de documentatie van deze nieuwe oplossingen en staat in voor de opleiding van de gebruikers van deze nieuwe technieken.Hij/zij neemt actief deel aan de verbetering van de applicatie in overleg met al zijn/haar collega's.Hij/zij is de back-up van de Data Reporting Expert:o Vervolledigt en past de entiteiten- en meetboomstructuur in de NRClick Scan-applicatie aan volgens de behoeften van interne en externe klanten, o Parametriseert de berekeningsformules van de meetperimeters.Hij/zij documenteert zijn activiteiten, voedt de documentatie bestemd voor interne en externe gebruikers. Hij/zij zorgt voor de basisopleiding in het gebruik van de applicatie.Helpdesk voor het data-acquisitiegedeelte.JE PROFIELJe hebt een bachelordiploma in data-analyse, automatisering of gelijkwaardige ervaring.Je kan de link leggen tussen het terrein en de systemen en je kan verschillende taken tegelijk beheren.Je hebt kennis over energiemeting en -tarifering.Je hebt kennis van informaticatalen en mathematische modellering.Kennis van de werking van de energiefactuur is een pluspunt.Je beheerst één van de twee voornaamste landstalen uitstekend en je hebt een goede kennis van de andere taal.Je gaat precies, methodisch en autonoom te werk.Je bent nieuwsgierig en oplossingsgericht. ONS AANBODEen zinvolle job ten dienste van de stad en haar inwoners in een activiteitensector die constant in evolutie is.Een degelijke en waardevolle opleiding.Een dynamische werkomgeving in het hart van Brussel waar de veiligheid van iedereen, medewerkers en inwoners, centraal staat.Een gezond evenwicht tussen werk en privéleven (mogelijkheid tot telewerk enz.).Een voordelig loonpakket en pakket extralegale voordelen (33 vakantiedagen, maaltijdcheques, verzekeringen zoals gezondheidszorgen, hospitalisatie en pensioen, 30% vermindering op de energiefactuur …).Kun je je vinden in deze functiebeschrijving en heb jij ook zin om je ten dienste te stellen van de Brusselaars? Aarzel dan niet en solliciteer bij Sibelga! Je komt terecht in een dynamisch bedrijf dat voortdurend evolueert met het oog op nieuwe technologieën, dat zich bekommert om het milieu en geeft om al zijn medewerkers.Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted Today

A área de Data Engineering é responsável por manter o ambiente de trabalho na nuvem (AWS e Azure), de forma a garantir segurança e eficiência no processamento de dados desde o primeiro contato com o cliente, passando pelo consumo destes dados pelos nossos Data Scientists, até a entrega dos dados finais ao cliente. Também se encarrega da captação, processamento e disponibilização da vasta quantidade de dados estruturados e desestruturados com os quais a empresa trabalha. Responsabilidades e atribuições Como Data Engineer, esperamos de você: Garantir que os dados sejam recebidos, apurados, transformados, armazenados e que estejam acessíveis para o time de DS; Construir e promover o gerenciamento de pipeline de dados, manutenção de bases de dados, construção de APIs para consumo de dados; Gerenciamento de dados em alta escala; Reunir e preparar dados para serem analisados e trabalhados, corrigindo possíveis falhas de processamento; Modelar novas bases de dados, e construir ETLs para novas solicitações; Agregar valor construindo, estruturando e otimizando dados para serem usados pelos times dos projetos internos. Requisitos e qualificações Domínio de Python e POO; Experiência em SQL, configuração e manutenção de sistemas de bancos de dados para garantia de performance e qualidade; Automatização de tarefas de coleta, transformação e armazenamento dos dados; Familiaridade com serviços cloud, principalmente Amazon Web Services: manutenção e operação da nossa estrutura na AWS (IAM, VPC, EC2, S3, Lambda, RDS, dentre outros); Boas noções em redes de computadores, segurança e sistemas Linux; Conhecimento dos conceitos e ferramentas relevantes da área de engenharia de software (Git, Gitlab, DevOps); O que esperamos de você como um/uma integrante de nosso time: Capacidade de se planejar com múltiplas prioridades concomitantes em um ambiente de rápido crescimento. Aqui você receberá tarefas de acordo com a sua capacidade e a sua fome; Foco em trabalhar como um time só, convivendo e trocando com todos dentro da Big Data sempre que necessário; Vontade de criar algo fora da curva e realmente mudar a tomada de decisão e visão de negócios dos nossos clientes com o seu trabalho; Estar aberto/a a diversidade de ideias e contribuição de todos; Criar conosco a melhor empresa de IA já conhecida em nosso mercado! <3 Informações adicionais O que você encontrará aqui: Ambiente informal e de muita troca e amizade; Pessoas apaixonadas pelo que fazem; Um aprendizado novo por dia; Local que está buscando seu melhor todos os dias; Crescimento e oportunidades mil ao seu redor; Salário competitivo e benefícios flexíveis.Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 3 days ago

At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us. Boeing Brazil is seeking a high performing Principle Flight Control Engineer reporting to the Airplane Systems Senior Management team. This role will support the teams at the Sao Jose Dos Campos, Brazil location. Principle Flight Control Engineer will be the technical leaders for design, analysis, testing and certification of flight control systems and components for large commercial aircraft as well as to lead support for the production and fleet operations of this equipment. The flight controls team is currently engaged in the challenging and exciting work of bringing new derivative airplanes into service as well as getting prepared to create the more capable, more efficient and even safer airliners of the future. This requisition is for multiple positions in multiple flight control disciplines performing many of the tasks listed below. Position Responsibilities: Lead the resolution of airplane level requirements into system level requirements and system level requirements into component requirements with time and cost-efficient validation methods. Lead the development of system and subsystem architecture alternatives to meet requirements and objectives. Lead the analysis and comparison of alternatives (trade study) to rapidly converge on preferred configurations including defining and executing system simulations and development test programs. Lead system, component and detail design efforts with thorough documentation within schedule and cost constraints to create error free, readily manufactured system and component specifications and drawings. Lead system level and component level validation analysis and testing, including: plan creation; consultation regarding iron bird, system and component test rigs; test monitoring; analysis and test report authoring; supplier test report review and approval; test failure analysis; and test failure mitigation. Lead the development of GNC and mathematical tools and techniques and aids in developing Technology roadmaps. Lead system, component and detail certification efforts, including: creation of required certification artifacts, such as, system safety analysis, failure modes and effects analysis, and fault tree analysis; confirming and demonstrating traceability to regulatory requirements; and resolution of regulation conflicts. Lead the support of initial production efforts including: timely resolution of prototype and first build problems at Boeing and supplier manufacturing facilities; ensuring readiness for production start-up milestones, such as, power-on, system gauntlet, system functional test, ground test and first flight; analysis and resolution of rejections and ground/flight test squawks; and ground/flight test data review for design validation and certification compliance. Lead the support of on-going production efforts including: timely resolution of build problems at Boeing and supplier manufacturing facilities; identifying and implementing design improvements to build accuracy, build rate, and production line safety; and timely resolution of rejections, functional test failures and flight squawks. Lead support of global fleet operations including: subject matter expert consultation for airline and regulator queries; Lead resolution efforts to resolve Service Related Problems (SRP); and analyze reported flight incidents to provide recommendations to the Safety Review Board (SRB) for Continued Operational Safety Program (COSP) determinations. Lead trade studies designs to meet program requirements. Train and coach others. Generally, these activities require successful cross-functional coordination within and outside of Boeing including with: manufacturing, avionics, crew-ops, airplane safety, aerodynamics, supply chain management, BCA systems software, suppliers, airline customers, and regulatory agencies. Employer is not willing to sponsor applicants for employment visa status. This position allows telecommuting. The selected candidate will be required to perform some work onsite at the listed location. job_description: Career Area: Engineering  Job Description: Basic Qualifications Education: Bachelor’s degree in an accredited Electrical Engineering or Equivalent Experience: 3-5 year of design experience Language: Pre - Advanced English Behavioral skills: analytical skills, good communication, teamwork, ability to organize Desirable Qualifications • Genset product knowledge • Understanding of UL, CSA, NFPA, and NEC requirements • Troubleshooting experience • Emphasis on initiative and self-starting tasks • Strong verbal and written communication skills. • Experience using Creo, and Team Center • Caterpillar design experience • Advanced English JOB DUTIES: Electric Power Division (EPD) has an opening for a Design Engineer (Electrical) in the Retail Electric Power and Solutions group located in PSB, Brazil. In this role, you will be taking ownership of 40 kW – 750 kW gensets fueled by diesel and natural gas for North Americas region. You will be providing shop support and conducting maintenance activities to solve complex technical problems, to maintain regular production to meet customer delivery dates. Expect to be hands on with the product and prepared to be mentored by multiple engineers. You will work with people across multiple organizations expanding your professional contacts and develop an understanding of the diversity of Caterpillar and its systems. Job Duties/Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to: • Provide engineering shop support of generator sets 40 kW – 750 kW manufactured in PSB , Brazil. • Introduce ICAs & PCAs to protect committed ship dates • Resolve PSB engineering quality issues and support quality initiatives. • Update designs of current products, components, and systems to meet customer requirements and the capabilities of process partners. • Work with regulatory experts to maintain certification requirements such as CSA, and UL. • Engage operations and supply chain to optimize designs for cost, quality, and assembly • Support generator sets throughout the product life cycle. • Provide technical guidance regarding test and analysis. • Maintain close communications with Assemblers and Test Engineers during product buildup and testing. • SME for PSB systems for REPS engineering team (NPI & maintenance) • Supplier collaboration and part localization. • A&I and CPI support (primarily NA region). • Lead MCR and new option introductions. #LI Caterpillar is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO). job_description: BenefitsPulled from the full job descriptionHealth insuranceLife insuranceIndeed's salary guideNot provided by employer$45.1K - $57.1K a year is Indeed's estimated salary for this role in Remoto. Sobre o time de Engineering & Software Development: Para nós, Data Science é um esporte de equipe - acreditamos e vivemos uma cultura horizontal, aberta, transparente e "anti-rockstar", e valorizamos a diversidade de experiências, perspectivas e background de cada um. A pessoa ideal para entrar na equipe tem que acreditar neste lema, estar preparada e aberta para encarar os mais variados tipos de desafios, pensar sempre em escalabilidade e agilidade, e ser colaborativa, criativa e investigativa - aqui quem vence são as grandes ideias. #Vemser4iers Responsabilidades e atribuições As suas principais responsabilidades serão: Trabalhar com um time multidisciplinar (em squads), seguindo o framework Scrum; Definir o fluxo dos dados gerados, com foco em alto desempenho, implementando processos e sistemas de monitoramento; Automatizar fluxos de dados; Coletar, limpar, tratar, catalogar, persistir e disponibilizar dados; Desenvolver e manter pipelines de dados, considerando complexidade e aumento do volume de dados, e visando escalabilidade; Analisar, sugerir e implementar novas tecnologias e stacks a serem utilizadas na criação de soluções para o ciclo de vida de dados; Fazer entregas constantes e contribuir para repositórios e documentos do time; Colaborar com outras pessoas de tecnologia, produto e ciências de dados para identificar e resolver problemas desafiadores. Requisitos e qualificações Você se encaixará perfeitamente nesta função se tiver : Histórico sólido desenvolvendo processamentos de dados em ambiente Spark (Synapse ou DataBricks) com PySpark. Histórico sólido desenvolvendo software em linguagens voltadas para dados, especialmente Python; Conhecimento em banco de dados relacionais SQL, Procedures e NoSQL (Sql Server, MySQL, PostgreSQL e MongoDB), principalmente relacionado a desempenho/tunning de consultas; Experiência em desenhar, construir e manter sistemas de processamento e ingestão de dados (ETL) e conhecimento funcional de Data Warehouse; Vontade de trabalhar com times multidisciplinares, usando Scrum e ferramentas como Jira, e em ambientes complexos e ritmo acelerado; Formação em cursos de Tecnologia é um diferencial (ex: Engenharia da Computação, Ciência da Computação, Sistemas de Informação). Diferencial: Entendimento de arquitetura de computação em nuvem, especialmente com soluções e serviços da Microsoft Azure (Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Data Factory, Storage Account); Formação em cursos de Tecnologia (ex: Engenharia da Computação, Ciência da Computação, Sistemas de Informação). Informações adicionais O que você vai encontrar na 4i: Contratação CLT; Remuneração varíavel anual (bônus) competitiva; Vale-alimentação e vale-refeição; Plano de Saúde (sem coparticipação); Telemedicina e desconto em medicamentos; Seguro de Vida; Possibilidade de trabalho 100% remoto, ou de usar os nossos escritórios em São Paulo, SP ou Santa Rita do Sapucaí, MG; Oportunidade para "colocar a mão na massa" e ver o impacto das suas contribuições; Um ambiente dinâmico, criativo e com aprendizados constantes; Acesso a qualquer pessoa e área - temos uma cultura horizontal. Sobre o nosso processo de recrutamento: O processo pode demorar 45 dias ou mais, desde a aplicação até à oferta, e o nosso time irá responder todas as candidaturas, mas pode ser que demore um pouco. Estas são as etapas: Aplicação Entrevista inicial - para conhecermos você um pouco mais. Avaliação técnica Entrevista com liderança Background check OfertaHiring InsightsJob activityPosted 30+ days ago

Job Description Summary Job Description Job Summary: The Datacenter Lead is involved in highly complex environments for installation, configuration and fault management. They provide technical support to GE customer/project. This includes remotely supporting clients within Service Level Agreements (SLAs) to install and configure software and hardware, resolve incidents, perform root cause analysis and adhere to any related processes such as change management. They are also required to provide technical leadership to the team supporting client installations. Responsible for setup and installation of technical systems, applications, or process designs for client’s purchased or outsourced technology and business process solutions. Works directly with client to manage initial access, map and transfer data, create process documentation, and train or coordinate training for client users. Tests and troubleshooting of functionality of installed systems; identifies and documents technical issues to be escalated to product and system integration teams for resolution. Provides feedback based on client experiences to GE teams for product and process improvements. May work directly with clients on-site or provide installation support remotely. The Data Center Lead will work firstly at Taubaté site during Executive project and Work statement preparation and after that must move and be resident at Foz do Iguaçu/PR. Roles and Responsibilities: Interact with clients on site to meet more complex requirements of a solution. Escalate unresolved problems and issues to the relevant third parties. Delegates lower complexity tasks to engineers and technicians. Assume responsibility for the co-ordination of the activities of the engineers, in line with performance targets, leading by example and monitoring the quality of engineer's and technician's work when required. Write reports and proposals and complete and maintain project documentation. Assist with the documentation of standard operating procedures relating to installations and fixes. Act as coach and mentor to more junior Implementation Engineers and Technicians. Assume responsibility for the co-ordination of the activities of the Engineers, in line with performance targets. May be required to serve periodically on the customer service desk, providing third line telephonic, remote and on-site support and problem management. Included in complex design work, with input to the design expected. Expected to take ownership of relevant technologies according to domain or specialization. Implement a new Customer complex Datacenter/Server environment using Vmware Suite, Microsoft Windows Server, AD (Active Directory), Backup solution/process Required Qualification: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or “STEM” Majors (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math) Proven track record working in complex Data Center and Server environment Microsoft Windows Server MCSE certification Proficiency in both Portuguese and English Desired Technical Expertise: Solid experience managing IT infrastructure datacenter/server services Experienced with high complex IT environment with high pressure Experience in ITSM (ARS Remedy, Service Now or similar) Experienced with private Cloud SDDC (Software Defined DataCenter) Experienced with Vmware VCloud Suite, vSAN and NSX (including Hypervisor SDN, SDS, SDC), VM (Virtual Machine) Experienced with Backup solution such as DELL/EMC DP5800 or Similar Experienced with Microsoft Windows Server and AD (Active Directory) Knowledge on CISCO UCS/VMWare Hyperconvergence solutions Deep understanding and appreciation of technical design and business principles Demonstrates solid project management and administration ability Sound project skills which are demonstrated in the execution of installations and other assignments Demonstrate customer engagement skills Demonstrate relevant domain specialist knowledge Excellent verbal communication skills Client focused and display a proactive approach to solving problems Ability to coach, mentor and provide guidance to team members Excellent understanding of project management principles Ability to proactively identify alternatives and make contingency plans Additional Information Relocation Assistance Provided: NoHiring InsightsJob activityPosted 3 days ago

job_description: Work Styles at Zoom    In most cases, you will have the opportunity to choose your preferred working location from the following options when you join Zoom: in-person, hybrid or remote. Visit this page for more information about      Zoom's Workstyles  .    About Us    Zoomies help people stay connected so they can get more done together. We set out to build the best video product for the enterprise, and today help people communicate better with products like Zoom Contact Center, Zoom Phone, Zoom Events, Zoom Apps, Zoom Rooms, and Zoom Webinar.    We’re problem-solvers, working at a fast pace to design solutions with our customers and users in mind. Here, you’ll work across teams to deliver impactful projects that are changing the way people communicate and enjoy opportunities to advance your career in a diverse, inclusive environment.    Candidate must reside in Brazil to be considered for this position*    Zoom is growing at an explosive pace by every measure revenues, people, innovation, and customers. Led by Eric S. Yuan, the #1 ranked CEO on Glassdoor, our unique culture makes Zoom an awesome place to work. We are expanding teams across the organization. If you are motivated by delivering happiness, come join us at Zoom!    Responsibilities      Responsible for the overall hands-on support of multiple data center environments        Possibility of travel to remote colocation facilities to support special projects, site expansion, decommission work, etc.        Perform server infrastructure upgrades and repairs such as: Motherboards/DIMM/Drives/NIC’s/RAID/SFP replacements        Perform Rack/Stack/Cabling activities as needed for both Network and Compute platforms        Ownership of on-site RMA process for various infrastructure platforms        Support Network Engineering, SysAdmin, and Project Management team to perform required work within the data center environment to achieve project deadlines        Monitor and carry out tasks through JIRA ticketing system as assigned by customer teams        Understand process for diagnostic methods of troubleshooting data center equipment, including Server, Network, Circuits and Layer-1 cabling issues. job_title: Quantitative Engineer - Global Markets - FAST X-Asset Strats
job_description: Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job Description MORE ABOUT THIS JOB:     We are seeking a talented individual to join Goldman Sachs fulltime in the Global Markets division as a Quantitative Engineer ("Applied AI Strat") at the Associate level on the FAST X-Asset Strats team in Toronto.  Global Markets   In the Global Markets Division our core value is building strong relationships with our institutional clients, which include corporations, financial service providers, and fund managers. We help them buy and sell financial products on exchanges around the world, raise funding, and manage risk. This is a dynamic, entrepreneurial team with a passion for the markets, with individuals who thrive in fast-paced, changing environments and are energized by a bustling trading floor.  Quantitative Engineer   At Goldman Sachs, our engineers don’t just make things – we make things possible. Our Quantitative Engineers ("strats") are at the cutting edge of our Global Markets businesses, solving real-world problems through a variety of analytical methods.  As an Applied AI Strat, you will use your advanced training in mathematics, programming and logical thinking to construct AI-based quantitative models that drive our success in global financial markets. Your talents for research, analysis and aptitude for innovation will define your contributions and enable you to find solutions to a broad range of problems, in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.  Whatever your background, you will bring a fresh perspective and unique skillset to our business. In return, you will be trained by our experts across the firm to navigate the complexities of the financial markets and state-of-the-art methods in quantitative finance.  FAST X-Asset Strats   As a Franchise Analytics, Strategy & Technology (FAST) X-Asset Strat, you will be working closely with the business to design, build and productionise end-to-end AI solutions and products that drive real time decision making.  RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS:   Responsibilities Design and build scalable AI models to drive commercial outcomes Conduct experimentation to improve model performance Communicate verbally and in writing to both strats and non-strats Improve existing and create new predictive machine learning models to drive real time trading and client service decisions Understand and analyze products and clients quantitatively, engineer features, and incorporate into models Identify, curate, and integrate new structured and unstructured datasets into models Build end to end solutions from data collection to automated actions Basic Qualifications Bachelors degree or above in a STEM area Programming experience in C++, Java, or Python and strong knowledge of data structures and algorithms 2 years experience as data scientist or academic work related to Machine Learning / Deep Learning / NLP Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, and experience with common data science toolkits Previous experience with A/B testing, hypothesis testing and experimental design Preferred Qualifications Experience in quantitative research Knowledge of financial markets and experience with financial data sets ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS:     ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS  At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.    We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.    We’re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html  © The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2021. All rights reserved.   Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 30+ days ago

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeBenefitsPulled from the full job descriptionTuition reimbursementIndeed's salary guideNot provided by employer$96.5K - $122K a year is Indeed's estimated salary for this role in Edmonton, AB. Full Job DescriptionDivision: Asset Management Location: Edmonton, AB COVID-19 Information : ATCO is committed to providing and maintaining a safe environment for our employees, contractors, partners, and customers. As part of this unwavering commitment to safety, all ATCO employees and contractors are required to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 or provide proof of exemption. Position Summary: Always there. Anywhere . That’s us! We are committed to delivering inspired solutions for a better world. We care about our communities, we care about each other, and we care about showing up for those who need us. We never break a promise, and we have the courage to do the right thing, even when it’s hard. We take pride in holding ourselves to the highest standard of integrity and excellence in all that we do. Come join an unconventional utility - one that will challenge you while you grow and develop. ATCO has some exciting projects underway such as Decarbonization, Renewables, Solar Photovoltaics (PV), Battery Energy Storage System (BESS), Combined Heat & Power (CHP), Microgrids, and Electrification of transportation. We want you to help shape our energy future. Come be part of the change! Are you a problem-solver who can think outside-the-box? Are you someone who can step back to look at the bigger picture? Someone who likes to interact with many different subject matter experts and facilitate discussions? Do you enjoy analyzing data and turning it into decision-making information for senior management? This opportunity will allow you to grow your leadership and communication skills, and allow you to make strategic, life-cycle decisions for ATCO Electric’s assets. Reporting to the Supervising Engineer, Asset Strategy & Analytics, this position is accountable for supporting the asset management activities for ATCO Electric’s transmission and distribution assets. The engineer will be responsible for developing and implementing comprehensive asset strategies for major asset classes using a risk-based approach. The engineer will also develop short and long-term asset maintenance and renewal plans, along with its business justifications, to support strategic business planning, regulatory forecasts, and resource requirements across the organization. Responsibilities: Develop asset management strategies and best practices for transmission and distribution (T&D) asset classes. Determine asset lifecycle strategy and develop renewal plans for T&D assets by analyzing asset risks and various operational indices (including asset condition, system criticality, reliability, operational constraints, and financial data). Develop technical scopes and provide business justifications for Capital projects, such as asset replacement/life extension, system improvement, and capacity upgrade. Develop and prioritize Operation & Maintenance (O&M) plans for T&D assets, including preventive and corrective maintenance programs. Lead/involve in the rollout of new engineering innovations and technologies, including assessing potential new technologies, participating in pilot projects, and developing company-wide implementation plans. Establish value frameworks for evaluating the risk and priority of proposed Capital and O&M programs. Provide input to the organization’s annual business plans based on short and long-term asset plans which aligned with corporate objectives. Support the overall regulatory application processes (Transmission General Tariff Application and Distribution Performance-based Regulation), including developing business cases, responding to information requests, as well as providing supports for filing updates and witness preparation. Conduct transmission reliability analysis to identify areas for improvement. Responsible for demonstrating transmission system compliance in accordance with AESO ARS requirements, such as PRC-005. Support the business in building and implementing IT/OT best practices to maintain high quality asset data. Support the management of non-regulated contracts to provide O&M services to owner company, including preparing annual maintenance plan and capital replacement plan. Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, preferably Electrical or Civil. Professional Engineer designation with APEGA. Five (5) to eight (8) years’ work experience, preferably in electrical utility environment. Knowledge of electrical utility system and its components/assets. Knowledge of strategic asset management and business planning, including T&D asset operation and maintenance planning, capital investment rationalization, as well as lifecycle value analysis. Knowledge of ISO 55001 is an asset. Basic understanding of the concepts of asset information register and computerized maintenance management system, such as Maximo, SAP, etc. Basic knowledge of developing query/coding for data analytics, such as Power BI, SQL, DAX, etc. Strong data analytical skills. Excellent report writing, communication, and presentation skills. Ability to collaborate with others, manage diverse relationships, and influence other groups. Facilitation skills to gather subject matter expertise and work toward consensus in the development of strategy framework and/or scope of work. Adapt to change and focus on continuous improvement. Maintain a Class 5 driver’s license in good standing. What We Offer: A culture based on caring, integrity, agility, collaboration, and striving for excellence Competitive compensation Flex benefits Tuition assistance program Training and mentorship programs Charitable donation matching We would like to thank everyone for their application; however, only those being considered for an interview will be contacted. ATCO Electric is part of ATCO Ltd. With approximately 6,000 employees and assets of $23 billion, ATCO is a diversified global holding corporation with investments in Structures & Logistics (workforce housing, innovative modular facilities, construction, site support services, and logistics and operations management), Energy Infrastructure (electricity generation, transmission and distribution; natural gas transmission, distribution and infrastructure development; energy storage and industrial water solutions; and electricity and natural gas retail sales), Transportation (ports and transportation logistics) and Commercial Real Estate. More information can be found at www.ATCO.com . ATCO is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law. Issued: May 16, 2022 Open until filled This position is administered under the supervisory/professional salary administration guidelines.Hiring InsightsJob activityPosted 30+ days ago

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionBachelor’s degree in a business or technical field Training, certification, or extensive experience with data analytics tools Working experience using Excel, Tableau, Quicksight, or similar BI tools 5+ years of professional experience in business intelligence engineering Job summary  Do you possess a passion for e-commerce, an obsession to make customers happy, and at the same time an ability to solve intrinsically hard technology problems ? Are you excited by the idea of directly influencing the foundation for Amazon’s future retail technology?  We are looking for a Business Intelligence Engineer (BIE) to work with internal stakeholders to provide data insights into our business. You will partner with team members across multiple disciplines including Product Management, Finance, Marketing, and Operations to develop new solutions. Our team is responsible for growing an innovative, confidential, and global project that uncovers and solves endemic problems in business and technology.  As a BIE, you equip our team with the tools they need to gain insights from our business data. You act as a team-wide asset for expertise on creating and maintaining our data repositories and reporting frameworks. You’re not afraid to roll up your sleeves and do what is necessary to deliver business insights. Core to your role is understanding the business needs for data and making data accessible and available to be interpreted. You are skilled at influencing technical and business teams and when confronted with discordant views, you are able to find the best way forward and build consensus. On top of this, you’re skilled at articulating your thoughts both in verbal in written form.  In this role, you solve data analysis problems of the broader organization and skillfully flex among various tools according to the problem and data. You help Amazon improve by deriving recommendations from analysis and recommending mechanisms that encourage a data-driven culture.  This role will be a good fit if you…  have a passion for eCommerce and data analysis have hands-on experience with various SQL and no-SQL data technologies, frameworks, and products have a demonstrated ability to derive insights out of data and anecdotes are entrepreneurial, optimistic, and like the challenges associated with working with ambiguity have an ability to decompose complex data sets into straightforward insights and metrics can understand business problems and immediately visualize the dashboard you will build to track their impact are a creative problem solver who can work with limited supervision have an analytical mind and are able to communicate complex issues in a concise way have the ability to work with technical and non-technical business owners to get things done are a skilled business and data-driven communicator, comfortable presenting across all levels of the organization Key job responsibilities  Liaise with various internal and external teams to gather data-relevant requirements Build and execute on an analytics roadmap to provide data to stakeholders including finance, marketing, technology, and operations Own the definition of key business metrics, with input from internal stakeholders Design, implement, and support data and reporting technology that provides business teams ad-hoc access to large data sets from multiple sources; influence the organization’s underlying BI architecture Run projects to interpret and analyze data and provide insights to stakeholders Understand business problems and find ways to visualize data in a way that stakeholders can discern the significance of information provided Streamline and automate the sharing of data-driven findings Proactively drive team-wide data insights reviews Standardize data and report creation/consumption across the team Prepare written recommendations to improve and innovate on the analytics experience to be shared with senior leadership Innovates and improves processes, simplifying and automating repetitive tasksProficiency with data querying or modelling technique with SQL Proficiency with a scripting language (Java, Python, or R) Background in process improvement, and/or consulting Track record of handling changing priorities and showing good judgement Excellent communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills Exposure to one of the following areas: eCommerce, Retail, Enterprise Software and the analytics capabilities used in those industries Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace.
